CareerCard.Title: Software Engineer
CareerCard.Overview: Software Engineers design, develop, test, and maintain software applications or systems. They play a critical role in translating user requirements into technical specifications and coding solutions that address these needs, ensuring functionality, efficiency, and reliability.

Benefits: High demand for skilled professionals, leading to job security.
Opportunities for remote work and flexible hours.
Potential for high salaries and career advancement.
Continual learning and adaptation to new technologies.
Job Challenges: Can lead to long hours and work-related stress.
Job satisfaction can be affected by project deadlines and client demands.
Requires ongoing education to keep up with rapid technology changes.
May involve repetitive tasks and debugging processes.

Dual Impact Highlights.Personal Growth: This career promotes critical thinking, problem-solving skills, and creativity, as engineers must continuously innovate and adapt to evolving technologies and challenges.
Dual Impact Highlights.Community Impact: Software Engineers contribute to societal progress by developing applications that enhance communication, education, and access to services, thereby improving the quality of life for people in their communities.

Level1ScenarioCards.Title: Initial Challenge 1
Level1ScenarioCards.Description: An entry-level Software Engineer is tasked with fixing bugs in an existing application to improve performance and user experience.

DecisionCards.Option A: Collaborate with more experienced team members to identify and resolve the bugs.

Outcomes.PersonalImpact: +Develops teamwork skills and gains valuable insights.

DecisionCards.Option B: Attempt to fix the bugs independently using online resources and documentation.

Outcomes.CommunityImpact: +Contributes to timely application updates for users.

Level2ScenarioCards.Title: Advanced Challenge 1
Level2ScenarioCards.Description: As a mid-level Software Engineer, you are responsible for leading the development of a new feature within the application, coordinating with both developers and stakeholders.

DecisionCards.Option A: Implement agile methodologies to streamline development and foster communication.

Outcomes.CommunityImpact: +Results in a better-organized and more responsive development process.

DecisionCards.Option B: Prioritize feature implementation based on stakeholder feedback, but risk overlooking technical limitations.

Outcomes.PersonalImpact: +Enhances understanding of business needs and client relations.
Outcomes.CommunityImpact: +May lead to a feature that doesn't fully address usage needs, affecting user satisfaction.
